comment.text: This translation key is used to display the text "Unselect all" on a dropdown menu within a web application, likely in a portal settings or developer tool context. When clicked, this button empties selected IDs, providing a way to reset selections in the UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Hamısı seçimini ləğv edin" is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Azerbaijani. A more natural phrasing would be something like "Seçimləri sil" or "Hamısı seçimi götür".
While "Zrušit výběr všech" is understandable, a more natural and common Czech translation for "Unselect all" would be "Odznotkovat vše" or "Zrušit výběr". "Zrušit výběr všech" is a bit clunky.

The translation 'Ապաընտրել բոլորը' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Unselect all'. 'Ապաընտրել' means 'to unchoose' or 'to undo a choice', but the combination with 'բոլորը' (all) is awkward and doesn't naturally express the concept of undoing a selection.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation might be something like 'Ջնջել ընտրվածը' (Jgnjel enkrvac) which means 'Delete the selected' or 'Remove selection', or 'Հեռացնել ընտրվածը' (Heracnel enkrvac) which means 'Remove the selected'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "すべて選択解除" is understandable, a more natural and precise translation of "Unselect all" would be "全件選択解除" or "選択解除すべて". "すべて選択解除" implies unselecting *everything* which might not be the intended meaning.

The translation '모두 선택 해제' while literally meaning 'deselect all', doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'Unselect all'. It implies a previous selection needs to be removed. 'Unselect all' can also simply mean to ensure nothing is currently selected.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: While '모두 선택 해제' is acceptable, consider alternatives like '선택 해제' (deselect) or '선택 없음' (no selection) depending on the precise intended meaning within the context of the webhook functionality.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Noņemt visu atlasi" is technically correct, it's a bit literal and clunky. A more natural and user-friendly translation for "Unselect all" would be something like "Atcelt atlasi" or "Notīrīt atlasi".
While technically correct, "Отменить выбор для всех" is a bit verbose and not the most natural translation for "Unselect all". A more concise and common phrasing would be better.

The translation "සියල්ල නොතෝරන්න" while literally meaning 'do not select all,' doesn't convey the same meaning as 'Unselect all'. It implies an action of not selecting, rather than reversing a previous selection.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation would be something along the lines of "මැකන්න සියල්ල" (makanna siyalla) which means 'remove all' or "ප්‍රතිස්ථානය සියල්ල" (pratisthana siyalla) which means 'reset all', depending on the function's purpose.  Without more context, it is difficult to provide a perfect translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation 'Zrušiť výber všetko' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Unselect all'. While technically understandable, it sounds awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation would be 'Odstrániť všetky položky' or 'Zrušiť všetky výbery'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'všetko' after 'výber' is grammatically slightly unusual. While not strictly incorrect, it's not idiomatic.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The addition of 'všetko' is unnecessary; the verb 'Zrušiť' implies totality.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation "Одзначи све" literally translates to "Mark all" or "Check all". It's the opposite of "Unselect all".

The translation 'Tümünün seçimini kaldır' is technically correct but sounds overly formal and slightly awkward in Turkish. A more natural and common phrasing would be 'Seçimi kaldır' or 'Seçimi iptal et'.
